title: Name that font
content:
Found this great font while queuing in the Post Office (again). Great impact and clarity. Does anyone know what it is? Where I can get it? Who’s done it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Royal Mail type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/typophile.com/files/Royal%20Mail%20type.jpg) | 211.25 KB |

 [‹ Is the Customer made or a font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14748 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sean John ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14698 "Go to next forum topic")
author: james backhurst

comments.content:
_Id guess and state.:_ Custom, corporate Royal Mail type.. :)  
_( Fontsmith designed [a custom typeface for Post Office](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.fontsmith.com/custom.php?id=485), in the past, maybe they did this one as well.? )_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.formlos.net/)

wow ... this is G-type’s [Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000003) brilliantly used here. Nice work for Nick Cooke to have such a high profile client in his portfolio ...

Ooh, Nice ID, George..

_( I failed once more, maybe its finally time for a vacation or some time off..  
Ill nominate George as my substitute / successor.. :)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.formlos.net/)

You’re right George. I was pretty chuffed when I first saw Chevin used for a Royal Mail advert. I was stunned when I realised the entire family had been adopted as the RM corporate typeface, and is used for absolutely everything.

James, I know what you mean about Post Office queues - don’t you just love slowly snaking your way to the counter. Position number 5 please!

I’m glad you like Chevin. It’s available in the UK from Fontworks. - [www.type.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214184046/http:/www.type.co.uk/ "www.type.co.uk")

Nick Cooke
